Skills: Reusable Knowledge System

Skills are reusable knowledge packages that provide domain expertise to AI agents. Unlike tools (which execute actions), skills provide knowledge that informs agent behavior.

Included in Foundation

Skills are part of the foundation bundle. Anyone using foundation automatically has skills capability!

No separate installation or configuration needed to get started.

Contents:
  • What Skills Are
  • Skills vs Other Concepts
  • How It Works
  • Using Skills
  • Loading from Git URLs (New!)
  • Creating Skills
  • Examples

What Skills Are

Skills follow the Anthropic Skills format:

  • Knowledge packages - Domain expertise, best practices, workflows
  • Progressive disclosure - 3 levels (metadata → content → references)
  • Reusable - Share across projects, teams, organizations
  • On-demand - Agent loads when needed (not all loaded upfront)

Progressive Disclosure Levels

Level What Tokens When Loaded
1. Metadata Name + description ~100 Always visible to agent
2. Content Full skill markdown 1-5k When agent calls load_skill
3. References Additional files 0 until accessed When agent references them

Why progressive: Agents see what's available (metadata) without loading everything. Prevents context bloat.

Skills vs Other Concepts

Concept What It Is Key Difference
Tools Execute actions Tools DO things (bash, web search). Skills KNOW things (best practices).
Context Static bundle files Context is yours. Skills are shared packages (can come from git).
Agents Pre-configured roles Agents are WHO. Skills are WHAT THEY KNOW (loaded on-demand).
Bundles Full configuration Bundles configure everything. Skills are knowledge loaded by tool-skills.

How It Works

Automatic Visibility

When skills are configured, agents see them before each request:

<available_skills>
Available skills (use load_skill tool):

- **python-testing**: Best practices for Python testing with pytest
- **git-workflow**: Git branching and commit message standards
- **api-design**: RESTful API design patterns
</available_skills>

No manual listing needed - The visibility hook injects this automatically!

Agent Workflow

User: "Set up Python testing for this project"

Agent sees: <available_skills> with "python-testing"

Agent thinks: "I should load the python-testing skill"

Agent calls: load_skill(skill_name="python-testing")

System returns: [Full pytest guide with examples]

Agent: Creates test structure following skill guidance

Using Skills

Configuration (Settings.yaml)

# Global (~/.amplifier/settings.yaml)
skills:
  dirs:
    - ~/.amplifier/skills            # Your personal skills
    - git+https://github.com/anthropics/skills@main  # Anthropic's library

# Project-specific (.amplifier/settings.local.yaml)
skills:
  dirs:
    - .amplifier/skills              # Project skills (merged with global)

The load_skill Tool

Operation Usage Returns
List all load_skill(list=true) Array of {name, description}
Search load_skill(search="python") Matching skills
Get metadata load_skill(info="skill-name") Name, description, version, etc.
Load content load_skill(skill_name="skill-name") Full skill markdown content

Loading from Git URLs (New Feature)

As of January 2026, skills can be loaded directly from git repositories without cloning locally.

Supported Formats

skills:
  dirs:
    # Full repository
    - git+https://github.com/anthropics/skills@main

    # Subdirectory within repo
    - git+https://github.com/myorg/shared@main#subdirectory=skills

    # Specific branch or tag
    - git+https://github.com/team/skills@v1.0.0

    # Mix local and remote
    - .amplifier/skills                          # Local
    - git+https://github.com/team/skills@main    # Remote

Benefits of Git URLs

  • No cloning - Automatic fetch and cache
  • Always current - Pull latest on update
  • Share easily - Just share URL, not files
  • Team sync - Everyone uses same skills version
  • Public libraries - Use Anthropic's or community skills

Example: Using Anthropic Skills

# In settings.yaml
skills:
  dirs:
    - git+https://github.com/anthropics/skills@main

# That's it! No git clone needed.

Run Amplifier, agent automatically sees all Anthropic skills:

amplifier run "What skills are available?"

# Agent responds with list from Anthropic's library

Creating Skills

Directory Structure

my-skills/
├── python-testing/
│   ├── SKILL.md          # Required: skill definition
│   └── examples/
│       └── pytest-setup.md
├── api-design/
│   ├── SKILL.md
│   └── rest-patterns.md
└── git-workflow/
    └── SKILL.md

SKILL.md Format

---
name: python-testing
description: Best practices for Python testing with pytest and coverage
version: 1.0.0
license: MIT
metadata:
  category: development
  tags: [python, testing, pytest]
---

# Python Testing Best Practices

This skill provides comprehensive guidance for Python testing.

## Quick Start

1. Install pytest: `pip install pytest pytest-cov`
2. Create tests/ directory
3. Name test files: `test_*.py`
4. Run: `pytest tests/`

## Test Structure

```python
def test_function_name():
    # Arrange
    input_data = ...

    # Act
    result = function_under_test(input_data)

    # Assert
    assert result == expected
```

## Coverage

Run with coverage:
```bash
pytest tests/ --cov=src --cov-report=html
```

Aim for 80%+ coverage on critical paths.

## References

- @python-testing:examples/pytest-setup.md

Best Practices for Skill Creation

  • Focused - One skill = one domain (not everything about Python)
  • Actionable - Provide steps, examples, code
  • Versioned - Use semantic versioning
  • Examples - Include reference files
  • Tested - Verify skills actually help agents

Configuration Reference

Bundle Configuration

# In bundle.md
tools:
  - module: tool-skills
    source: git+https://github.com/microsoft/amplifier-module-tool-skills@main
    config:
      skills_dirs:
        - .amplifier/skills
        - git+https://github.com/anthropics/skills@main
      visibility:
        enabled: true          # Show automatically (default)
        max_skills_visible: 50 # Limit for large collections

Settings.yaml (Recommended)

# Global skills (all bundles)
skills:
  dirs:
    - ~/.amplifier/skills
    - git+https://github.com/team/shared-skills@main

Priority Order

  1. Bundle config (skills_dirs) - Highest
  2. Settings.yaml (skills.dirs) - Recommended
  3. Defaults (.amplifier/skills, ~/.amplifier/skills) - Fallback

When to Use Skills

✅ Use Skills For
  • Reusable domain knowledge
  • Best practices and standards
  • Team-wide conventions
  • External expertise (Anthropic's library)
  • Knowledge that changes over time
Use Context For
  • Project-specific instructions
  • One-off guidance
  • Static, unchanging content
  • Bundle-specific instructions

Programmatic Usage

from amplifier_foundation.registry import load_bundle

# Load bundle with skills
bundle = await load_bundle("./bundle.md")
prepared = await bundle.prepare()
session = await prepared.create_session(session_id="skill-user")

# Get skills tool
skills_tool = session.coordinator.get("tools", "load_skill")

# List available skills
result = await skills_tool.execute({"list": True})
skills = result.output.get("skills", [])
print(f"Found {len(skills)} skills")

# Load specific skill
result = await skills_tool.execute({"skill_name": "python-testing"})
content = result.output.get("content")
print(content)  # Full skill markdown

Getting Started

Skills are already in foundation. Just add some:

# Add Anthropic's library
echo "skills:
  dirs:
    - git+https://github.com/anthropics/skills@main" >> ~/.amplifier/settings.yaml

# Use them
amplifier run "What skills are available?"
amplifier run "Load the git skill and help me write better commit messages"
